title: [QUESTION] SkElement or skiaSharp is not working in some windows PC's
body:
We used skia in our project to draw lines on . a bitmap based on user Input(at runtime). We then used the timer to trigger skElement PaintSurface Event( by calling InvalidateVisual() API). In the PaintSurface Event handler, we draw the skBitmap on the canvas.

This approach is working for most of the windows users. But only a couple of customer this approach is not working. 
We tried to look for any settings change but couldn't find any.

We tried below skia's sample project which updates the frame number. This example project working fine for us i.e, we could see the frame number keeps increasing. This sample project also is not working for our customers. The frame number stops with number 1 and is not updating further.
https://lostindetails.com/articles/skiasharp-with-wpf

Could you please help us to understand why above solution is not working in some PC's please?
Please let us know if you are in need of more information.

Thanks

comments.author: mimocvb
comments.body:
Excuse me, have you solved this problem
I encountered the same problem. I tested the program on my laptop and found that using Invalidate Visual cannot re render, but changing the window size can be done.
When I test on a desktop computer, he can trigger a re rendering using InvalidateVisual
Notebook is i5-1135G7, XE gpu, without independent graphics card
Desktop has a separate graphics card

comments.author: hansangwook83
comments.body:
Issue has been resolved.
This issue is not a Skia issue.
It was a VGA Driver issue.


laptop model : SAMSUNG NT950XDB
VGA : Intel(R) Iris(R) Xe Graphics

[before driver version]
27.20.100.9415(2021-03-22 AM 9:00:00)

[after driver version]
31.0.101.4577(2023-07-24 AM 9:00:00)
